result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:35 AM Defendant SARAH K STOLL in court with Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond, for Attorney Lester Liptak.  Lawrence Jean Broeren appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
21CF351, 21CM145, 22CF103.  Attorney waives reading of complaint. 
Defendant is informed of charges.  Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint.  Reviewing discovery on older matters. Bond continued.  Review hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

08:38 AM Defendant SARAH K STOLL in court with Attorney Lester H Liptak.  Scott Zehr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State awaiting police reports. Complaint has not been filed at this time. 
Complete booking process. 
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

BOND COVERS 21CF351 (MODFIED), 21CM145 (MODIFIED), & NEW
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to associate with anyone involved in illegal drug activities.
Comply with all DHS orders.

21CF351, 21CM145, & NEW
